ROMANCE WRITERS WANTED NOW! | LONG-TERM WORK | HIRING NOW

Company: HotGhostWriter Ltd.
Location: Work Remotely
Job Type: Contract
Description

Are you looking to earn a consistent income writing high-quality novels in your favorite Romance subgenres and themes?

Then this could well be your next paid writing gig!

 

Job Overview

We are currently looking to expand our fiction team with amazing and experienced romance writers (based in the US or Canada) in all romance subgenres. We are a fast-paced, growing ghostwriting service that can provide you with consistent and exciting projects week after week! Regardless of your romance subgenre preferences, we may have a job for you.

If you are someone that takes pride in their work and is looking to earn a consistent income doing something you enjoy, working from the comfort of your home or office, and doing so alongside an excited and brilliant team, then you may just fit our criteria and land yourself an exciting new gig with us.

 

The Company

As a company, our brand is synonymous with the highest quality writing and great customer experience. Our online reviews are a testament to that. We are thrilled about this and continue to strive for more.

However, our focus is not just on our clients, but also on the team that makes it happen. We love our team and focus on creating an enjoyable working process and keeping their pipelines full with great projects, bringing them a steady income.

In return, our writers ensure that every client that walks through our virtual doors receives an outstanding experience and walks away happy with their product. As a collective, we are always looking to improve and this as allowed our company to grow.

We also focus on helping our writers grow- we do this via a number of development programs we run such as our book club, mastermind groups, editor feedback, writing discussions, and more. This ensures that every writer that passes through HotGhostWriter grows and takes their craft to a higher level. Keep reading if this resonates with you.

 

Pay Rate

Our current rate is $15 USD per 1,000 words. Our projects range from 20k up to 150k words.

Some of our busier writers are earning $2,000+ a month writing a few hours a day around their studies or other gigs. We offer consistent work without having to apply for jobs, work comes to you. Plus, you'll love the team and process!

 

Our Requirements

We are looking for romance writers with at least a good basic skill level and a good understanding of the conventions of the romance subgenre as a whole, and of your preferred romance themes. Here's what's required to be part of our team:

- You write amazing romance stories. With a lot of tension, suspense, great dialogue, and good character development and characterization.
- You are US/CAN based, or US/CAN citizen living outside the country.
- You can work with deadlines. We typically deliver 15k words in 1 week/ week and a half.
- You are knowledgeable in your preferred romance subgenres, themes/tropes. You understand the readers, you understand basic conventions that make a subgenre/theme/etc and you can write to market.
- You take pride in your writing and can consistently deliver high-quality novels. You focus on delivering what the reader and client want.
- You are looking for a long-term gig and are eager & available to start.
- You are available throughout the day to respond to team and client messages on our platform.
- You are reliable, well-spoken, open to constructive criticism and a good communicator.

 

Few things to consider before applying

Important: When applying you will be asked to select up to 3 of your best subgenres. Choose the subgenres you most enjoy and know most about (conventions, typical characters, etc). Please submit a sample for each subgenre you select. If you are successful, we will hire you for 1, 2 or all 3 of your chosen subgenres based on your ability to write and your understanding of each subgenre's conventions. We put a lot of emphasis on this as it's vital to understand what the reader wants.

We will also prioritize you that can commit for at least 3-6 months. This is because we love to establish long-term relationships with our team and also because our clients love to create a series of projects with the same writer. Once expectations are clear with a client, you can expect awesome projects to keep flowing your way. This requires a basic commitment of 3 months or so.

Also, you must be able to sit down and write in order to meet deadlines. Good planning should make this easier. Again, availability throughout the day to respond to messages on our platform is essential.

Finally, you must be okay with not getting official credit for your writing as this is a ghostwriting position.

 

How To Apply?

So if read what the position entails and you're excited to test your luck and apply? That's amazing and we look forward to getting your application. To apply, click the link below to complete our form where you will have to answer a number of questions and also provide your writing samples. If you're a little reluctant based on your professional experience, don't let that stop you. As long as you have some samples and you understand romance, we'd love to consider you.

 

Application Form

https://airtable.com/shrk4Ug4RngCp1fC3

Please remember to provide at least 1 sample per subgenre you select (Choose no more than 3 subgenres). Each sample must be at least 1,000 words.

We do get numerous applications on a daily basis, so do bear with us and allow us at least 2 weeks to get to your application.

 

Best of luck!

Hotghostwriter Recruitment Department

Hotghostwriter.com

P.S. Have any questions?

Contact us: [email protected]

Who are we?
We are EatFirst, an online food brand designed for delivery. Our team of Michelin-star trained chefs produces small batch, handcrafted meals using unique ingredients to make you feel good. We do not use any colourings, flavourings, additives or preservatives and we use only eco-friendly plastic-free packaging. We are based in London and deliver food to individual and corporate customers all across the UK.

What do we offer?
You will become part of a star team of international, experienced foodies, with the opportunity to learn from the best talent in hospitality. EatFirst has a fast paced, dynamic work environment where creativity and talent is encouraged and nurtured.
Free lunch every day and free coffee and tea in our office.

What does the role involve?
You will be actively involved in the company’s recruitment process and all things HR-related. This is the perfect opportunity to get in-depth, hands-on experience in start-up HR. The role offers wide exposure to all departments within EatFirst as well as dealing with recruiters and service providers.
Tasks include recruiting talent for different positions within EatFirst (above all for our production kitchen), defining and improving processes from profile scanning to onboarding to performance reviews, maintaining employment contracts, assisting with the payroll process.

Requirements
We are looking for a motivated individual to join the team who is looking to pursue a career in HR with some pre-existing experience or knowledge required. In terms of personal attributes, the role requires someone who is intelligent, capable of acquiring new skills and passionate about their work. In addition, should have excellent interpersonal skills and a very good level of English.
At the end of the Internship this role could evolve into a full-time position.
Applications from both graduates and undergraduates will be considered.

Interested? Contact us!

items.content:
Talent Manager at Grafana Labs

Remote

REMOTE ¬∑ United States ¬∑ G&A

DESCRIPTION

Location: East coast USA preferred/other locations considered

We are looking for a Talent Manager to join our People Ops team to take responsibility for delivering our ambitious global headcount plans. The People Ops mission is to ensure we deliver a highly skilled, committed, successful and happy team and this role will play an integral part in the delivery of that work as we grow. One of our core values is ‚Äòbuilt better together‚Äô and you will apply this to the growth of our team helping to ensure we maintain our strong culture and values as we grow.

This is a fantastic opportunity to help an ambitious tech startup meet our growth plans whilst also getting to work on some really interesting projects. You will take responsibility for the full lifecycle of both technical and non-technical international recruitment. In addition you will have the opportunity to partner with the VP People Ops to contribute to the delivery of projects focussed on recruitment processes, candidate experience, diversity and internal stakeholder recruitment training programs.

If you are an experienced recruiter, ready for a new challenge and enjoy making an impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

REQUIREMENTS

  • You will work alongside our Leadership team to deeply understand hiring requirements, hiring challenges, organisational structure and individual team dynamics
  • You will be responsible for the end to end recruitment process covering the entire candidate experience from sourcing and headhunting through to offer stage
  • You will be confident engaging passive candidates and utilising the team‚Äôs networks and technical experience to engage with candidates appropriately. You will be tasked with direct sourcing and keeping agency spend to a minimum.
  • You will be required to work with a mix of both technical and commercial international teams
  • You will have experience putting together role specific hiring and sourcing strategies using a broad range of channels including LinkedIn, Stack Overflow, Github, job boards, networking etc
  • You will quickly be able to understand our key requirements and good cultural fit and help to screen candidates based on your strong understanding of what we value and our company culture
  • You will help to champion diversity through our recruitment and work with the VP People Ops to build out a diversity hiring strategy for 2019 and beyond
  • You will work closely with the VP People Ops to review and enhance our recruitment process and to develop and deliver a recruitment best practice training program to the internal team

What would make you a good fit for this role?

We‚Äôre a startup so your job duties will be varied and complex and will require strong judgement, collaboration and leadership. Initially this will be a standalone role and you will need to have the experience, drive and energy to hit the ground running working proactively and independently to deliver a first class recruitment service to the business and to candidates.

To be successful in this role you will have experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced global start-up. You will need excellent sourcing/research skills and have an ability to discover candidates for hard to fill requisitions through creative sourcing. It is essential that you have experience recruiting internationally in both Europe and the US.

You will have strong people and communication skills and will be adept at interacting with a variety of people at different levels and from different cultures and backgrounds.

BENEFITS

At our core Grafana Labs is an open company. We believe that open source is the superior way to build and deliver software. We also believe in being open and transparent with our employees. We believe that transparency breeds trust and that trust is the foundation of great teamwork. We actively seek to break down silos, empower employees with information and allow people to ‚Äúsee the whole picture‚Äù. This transparency extends to our strategy, our financials, our successes and failures. We empower our team to make their own decisions and trust that they will try to do the right thing.

We are a remote first team. Our three founders are on three different continents and our team of 70+ global employees are based in 15+ different countries. Hiring remotely unlocks the broadest, most diverse, most talented pool of potential employees. It also means that we have built our culture around a flexible and autonomous work environment based on trust.

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Grafana Labs we‚Äôre building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay, and to do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we‚Äôre working hard to make sure that‚Äôs the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

FundApps is a startup that helps investment managers stay in compliance with global regulations. Our competition is stuck in the dark ages with slow, clunky, complicated user interfaces and installed software. We're shaking up the industry - providing a beautiful & intuitive web-based service which takes away our clients' pains and lets them get on with what they do best.

We've won multiple accolades from organisations such as Wired, World Economic Forum, Deloitte amongst others.

*About Us*
We're a small team (currently 60 people) of smart, friendly people with amazing diversity - 26 nationalities at last count. Our HQ is in London, we have growing offices in New York and Singapore, and remote team members in Copenhagen, Amsterdam and Darlington. We collaborate very closely and take pride in delivering an amazing service to our clients, who are some of the world's largest asset managers, hedge funds and pension funds.

We've successfully bootstrapped our way to profitability, so have an incredible amount of freedom when it comes to creating our own destiny.

Despite the heavyweight clients, we pride ourselves on not taking ourselves too seriously, on doing good by our people, our communities and the environment (we became a B-Corp in 2018) and having bucket-loads of fun along the way!

*The Team*
People Operations (nicknamed POPS internally) was introduced in late 2017 to help smooth the next phase in growth of FundApps as we scale. We‚Äôre a two person team currently and take culture super seriously like any growing company worth its salt.

*Rohan* is currently our Talent Partner in London and will soon be focusing on our Learning & Development initiatives including our leadership development, career conversations, early careers, onboarding and general learning content. When Rohan is not at FundApps you‚Äôll find him at a rugby game or training for his next trail marathon.

*Pat* is our Head of People based in New York, and covers a generalist remit including supporting our leadership team, growth planning, reward & payroll and employee relations. Outside of FundApps, you‚Äôll likely find Pat exploring the city, drinking coffee, or planning a return to the tennis court.

Then there‚Äôs *YOU!* As our third member of POPS, you‚Äôll be responsible for all recruitment activities across FundApps, including sourcing, branding, recruitment and employer/agency partnerships. We‚Äôve invested heavily in recruitment early in our journey - We have a scalable ATS, an event calendar and university & agency partnerships in place to help source amazing people. Nonetheless, we‚Äôre growing quickly and need to continue to raise the bar and deliver a punchy and world-class recruitment and talent process that supports our growth ambitions.

Simply put, your remit will be - *Find the world's most talented people and bring them to FundApps.*

Outside of work, we don‚Äôt mind what your interests are, provided you have something you‚Äôre passionate about that‚Äôs not FundApps! :)

*Responsibilities*
* Talent Sourcing (50%): Partner with team leaders to understand and anticipate hiring needs, build sourcing strategies and scout talent globally across job platforms.
* Recruiting (40%): Build a world-class candidate experience and manage the end to end recruitment cycle. Analyse talent metrics to find scalable improvements in how we recruit the top tech and business talent globally. Deliver at pace, but never at the expense of a personable and authentic experience.
* Employer Branding (10%): Be an ambassador to the FundApps employer brand and active player in industry and recruitment events and meetups and across social media.


*REQUIREMENTS*
* Ideally 2+ years demonstrable experience in an in-house generalist HR, recruitment or talent agency role requiring partnership with hiring managers.
* Flawless written and verbal communication skills and be comfortable talking with people at all levels
* An expert relationship-builder - with hiring managers, agencies, industry reps and candidates.
* Ability to analyse data and metrics of success with an eye for detail

Bonus Points
* Experience in recruiting technical roles, including developers
* Experience managing agency relationships and using hiring platforms
* Master of GIFs, emojis and HR/recruitment puns

*VALUES FIT*

* Raise the Bar - Creative mindset and commitment to continuously raising the bar on how we approach recruitment
* Do More with Less - Without the deep pockets of a VC we have to make smart decisions and everyone at FundApps has an agile & lean mindset.
* Have Courage - Not afraid to roll sleeves up, build fluency in our service and have the tough conversations when they arise
* Be Transparent - We default to transparency within our company, when it comes to our recruitment performance and our high/low points along the way. If this makes you feel uncomfortable, we may not be the right company for you.
* Work with Purpose - We take on average 2 days to evaluate a new job application, and maintain an average of 25 days from application to offer stage. We wouldn‚Äôt have achieved this without laser sharp focus and a comfort prioritising lower value work.

*LIFE AT FUNDAPPS*

* ¬£1,000 learning budget each year and unlimited professional development leave
* Peer micro-bonuses through Bonusly
* Flexible working - 90% of our team do it regularly
* 25 days holiday leave + an extra day next year if you use it all
* Birthday off

* Unlimited sick and compassionate leave
* Monthly team outings, including crazy golf, karaoke and escape rooms
* Peer-led ‚ÄòBrown-bag lunch‚Äô learning sessions
* Matched pension contribution up to 10%
* Flexible wellbeing allowance

We are proud of the diversity of all FundAppers - it makes us strong. You will find flexibility around religious observances, our national flags all around the office, a monthly ‚ÄòLaydeez who lunch‚Äô and a Pride celebration with some epic Cher and RuPaul playlists! If you‚Äôre looking for a workplace where you can just be yourself, you‚Äôre in the right place.

Recruiting and Talent Lead at Tidelift

Remote | Entry-level

What were building
At Tidelift, our mission is making open source software work betterfor everyone. We see a world where open source creators can get paid for doing work they love, and software development teams get software they can depend on. Were already supporting many of the most important projects in open source, and adding more all the time.

We‚Äôre still small, but well-funded and growing. You will be able to play a large role in tackling challenging problems and helping build the company, while learning alongside our experienced team.

How you can help

We‚Äôre looking for a Recruiting and Talent Lead to build the recruiting programs for Tidelift. As our first dedicated People Operations team member, you will help build an effective, diverse, values-driven team.

You will own our recruiting efforts from beginning to end, including:

  • Work with teams and hiring managers to define roles, and build structured interview materials that help us identify the best candidates (not just the ones who mirror our own biases)
  • Refine and implement our recruiting process, including finding diverse candidates, scheduling interviews, and managing evaluations (screening, internal, and references), and ensuring were using appropriate tooling. (We currently use Google Hire but are open to candidates with other preferences/experience.)
  • Drive the candidate and new employee experience. We consider user experience critical to everything we do, including how we bring people into the company, from the first time they read our job description to the time theyre fully onboarded. Youll help us make that happen in partnership with internal and external resources.
  • Support culture in a time of growth: we plan to more than double in size in 2019. This role will advise and support the leadership team to ensure our culture stays healthy and supportive through that transition.

Prior experience with people operations at a growing startup is a plus, but were open to a candidate who is excited to recruit and can grow into a broader people operations role.

This team

You will be the first hire in our People Ops team. You will collaborate with an experienced leadership team that has seen and managed explosive growth at HubSpot, Red Hat, Wikipedia, and a wide variety of other startups. The role will report to a co-founder, and will also work closely with our head of marketing, who led Red Hats efforts to ensure that the brand and culture were closely intertwined.

Our values

Were trying to build a healthy, values-driven culture. We want to be:

  • Optimistic: We see an amazing future ahead, and want to inspire others to share in it. This is both internalbuilding each other up and looking for the best in peopleand externalwe know open source is awesome, and we want to make it even better.
  • Practical: We know words and ideas alone wont change lives. We help people most by creating a pragmatic, viable, and sustainable business that works for everyone. So we care about usability, design, and honest assessment of costs and benefits.
  • Additive: We want an environment that encourages and inspires growth, both for individuals and for the open source community as a whole. That means embracing a growth mindset, and valuing culture add over culture fit.
  • Inclusive: We believe technology will be stronger when it better reflects the voices and ideas of society as a whole. So we want people from different backgrounds and experiences to not just be represented, but to be heard, valued, and flourish. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment.

How we work

  • In this role, you can work remotely (within the US) or from our office in downtown Boston. About half of our team, including two of our founders, are remote, and we take employee experience seriously wherever you are based.
  • We believe in the urgency of our mission, and the importance of doing good work, but also know this is a marathon and not a sprint. Hours can be flexible within reason if necessary to meet personal needs (like child, medical, or elder care).

Compensation, benefits, and career

  • Compensation is competitive with other Boston-area startups, including key benefits like health insurance, flexible vacation, 401(k), parental leave, and equity.
  • We are invested in every employees growth, and support professional development that aligns with your goals and how you learn best.

How to apply

Sourcing Operations Associate | programming knowledge required.

Code For Cash recruits software developers in ways that are high-integrity, non-intrusive and mutually profitable, and we are hiring a sourcing operations associate .  In plain English, this means we need someone to find great potential employees for our clients, even if they‚Äôre not on the job market.

We need someone who's smart and thinks critically.  We need someone who is punctual and reliable, who gets things done but also has the courage to challenge and improve our processes if they think there is a better way.  We need someone who is hungry for success but has the personal boundaries and self-discipline to lead a sustainable, spiritually fulfilling life. Culturally, it's essential that you have some professional programming experience, either full-time or as a freelancer.  Other than that, there are no rules, and we hope to welcome you into our eclectic culture.

Details

This is a remote job.  You are expected to be available for at least four hours between 10am and 6pm USA Eastern Time.  You must have authorization to work with a USA company but may be located anywhere in the world.

Requirements

  • Native-level English fluency and flawless grammar (it's okay if you're aided by Grammarly, as long as you're consistent in using it!)

  • HTML and CSS knowledge, comfortable adapting responsive templates

  • Power use of web software (i.e. you know the hotkeys for many apps; you are comfortable using Zapier in complex ways if necessary)

  • Experience with Git and GitHub

Compensation

Negotiable, depending on experience.  Equity after standard one-year cliff. Additional equity awards for work that impacts the business at a unit economics level.

Will I belong?

  • Our backgrounds are extraordinarily different; we are united by our love of technology and our desire for independence and freedom.  

  • We‚Äôre winners.  Are you as well?

  • We like to work quickly.  Can you keep up?

  • Check out our vibe at https://codefor.cash/aboutus

What‚Äôs the impact the company has on the world?  

  • For candidates, we're making it a lot easier to find a great job in tech.

  • For employers, we're making the process of adding a new employee more seamless.

What colleagues am I going to be interacting with day to day, and who benefits from my work?

You're primarily going to be interacting with the client-facing Account Executives. e.g., Zack (https://www.linkedin.com/in/zackburt)  

What are the growth and learning opportunities for everyone in the company?

  • Paid training: increase your technical and marketing skills.

  • Book club. We will buy you any book you want as long as you summarize your findings into a blog post.

  • As many online courses as you want, as long as you share your learning with the team and apply them in your day to day work.

  • People are always encouraged to increase their responsibilities as long as their existing responsibilities are well cared for.

What‚Äôs work of this position like day to day?

  • Keep your Account Exec in the loop with your progress with 2x daily updates, at the start of the day and at the end of the day.

  • Going through Craigslist, Indeed, GitHub, LinkedIn and searching for professionals that match our clients‚Äô criteria.

  • Leverage browser extensions and programming to partially automate all aspects of your work, with the goal of gradually creating end-to-end automation.

  • Update our Operations Associate handbook constantly as we are reassembling the airplane in the air.

  • Building landing pages that properly describe our roles.

  • Launching advertising campaigns to target our candidates.

What am I going to be doing in 6 months?

  • If you are enjoying your position and want work-life balance, you are encouraged to stay in it.

  • If you are ambitious and would like a promotion, you are expected to increasingly automate all aspects of your work and then hire someone to delegate your work to.  Within 6 months, you could be managing an entire team.

What specific skills and values are you looking for? What will candidates be evaluated on?

  • Do we get along with you personally: do we enjoy our interactions and do they leave us feeling energized?

  • Are you motivated to do the work, even if outside your job description?

  • Are you professional and reliable in that you show up to meetings prepared?

  • Does your application demonstrate attention to detail and thoughtfulness?

Compensation

Negotiable, depending on experience. Equity after standard one-year cliff. Additional equity awards for work that impacts the business at a unit economics level.

How to apply

You'll need a clean, pdf format version of your resume.  Then, take that pdf and convert it into HTML and CSS...nothing fancy, but make the page look exactly like the pdf.  Send an email with your resume in pdf format and a link to the live webpage version. We promise to respond to everyone who applies within these parameters!  

The interview process

  1. Apply according to the instructions

  2. 10 minute video meeting with Zack, the Account Exec

  3. 10 minute meeting with two other colleagues

  4. We'll extend you a contract offer with DocuSign and set you up with Gusto payroll

  5. Anyone who overdelivers in the first week is going to be offered continued employment
